bibl.title: Letter from J.O. Skinner to Howard A. Kelly, October 9, 1907

div1.p: Skinner writes that he will attend a meeting at the Maryland Club. He expresses his sentiments for Carroll.

div1.head: Letter from J.O. Skinner to Howard A. Kelly, October 9, 1907
div1.opener:
DR. J.O. SKINNER,
SUPERINTENDENT.
COLUMBIA HOSPITAL FOR WOMEN,
WASHINGTON, D.C. Oct 9-'07
My dear Dr Kelly-
div1.p:
Your very kind invitation- for
Oct 14- at the Maryland Club
& subsequently - has just been rec'd
after a return from an absence
from town - since Sept 2 - so that
you can imagine the size and
condition in wh- I found the
- wood pile here- where I am
at work trying to keep the “stokers”
supplied with suitable fuel for their purpose
DR. J.O. SKINNER,
SUPERINTENDENT.
COLUMBIA HOSPITAL FOR WOMEN,
WASHINGTON. D.C.
(2)
If possible. I shall be greatly
pleased to be with you on the
occasion to wh-. You refer-
-- one so full of sadness and
sorrow- for every thoughtful and
appreciative person - and particularly
so far more where admiration
and affection for an allene and
useful man - extends - as Vore Dyke
expresses it -- “beyond the years”.
Thanking you for your kindness &
courtesy- Believe me with great esteem,
